definition: to emit/to give off/to send out (or up, forth)/to brave/to face/reckless/to falsely adopt (sb's identity etc)/to feign/(literary) to cover
to venture to/to presume to/to take the liberty of

sentences.english: She offered a few ideas to improve the plan.
sentences.chinese: 我将不揣冒昧，提出一个修改意见。

sentences.english: Take the liberty to write you this letter of recommendation, please your taking the time to look at.
sentences.chinese: 冒昧给您写这封建议书，请您在百忙中抽空看一看。

sentences.english: We take liberty of writing to you with a view to establish business relations with you.
sentences.chinese: 我们冒昧写信一起与贵公司建立合作关系。

sentences.english: So please forgive me to write such a mail to you, sincerely hope this open way will not offend you.
sentences.chinese: 所以请原谅我写这样一封信，冒昧之处多多海涵。

sentences.english: May I suggest a visit to our showrooms?
sentences.chinese: 在此非常冒昧地建议您参观我们的样品展览室。

sentences.english: May I be as bold as to ask what you need it for? We have different types of limousines.
sentences.chinese: 冒昧请问有特殊的需求吗？我们的礼车有分等级。

sentences.english: I took the liberty of ordering for you. bombay sapphire, three limes.
sentences.chinese: 恕我冒昧约你来此，孟买蓝宝石，三杯莱檬。

sentences.english: I took the liberty of reminding her of the real facts.
sentences.chinese: 我不揣冒昧地提醒她注意事实。

sentences.english: Please allow me to do some self-introduction.
sentences.chinese: 很冒昧第一次给您写信，请允许我先做一下自我介绍。

sentences.english: A:May I venture to ask if you've decided to employ Mark?
sentences.chinese: 我能冒昧地问一问你是否决定雇佣马克了呢？

sentences.english: May I take the liberty of asking your ladyship whether you left Mr. and Mrs. Collins well.
sentences.chinese: 我是否可以冒昧请问你夫人一声，柯林斯夫妇都好吗？

sentences.english: And who is Dinah, if I might venture to ask the question?
sentences.chinese: 请允许我冒昧地问一下，那么，黛娜是谁呢？

sentences.english: I’ve taken the liberty of inviting my assistant, Mr. Yong.
sentences.chinese: 我冒昧地请了我的助手Yong先生。

sentences.english: I will venture to send a suggested correction of it.
sentences.chinese: 我将不揣冒昧，提出一个修改意见。

sentences.english: I took the liberty of borrowing your lawn-mower while you were away.
sentences.chinese: 你不在的时候我冒昧用了你的割草机。

sentences.english: We take the liberty of annexe our export price of wine for the current year, and solicit the favour of your patronage.
sentences.chinese: 现冒昧寄上本年度葡萄酒出口价格表一份，请多关照。

definition: (courteous) to be so bold as to
lit. your honored carriage/your highness/honored Sir (also sarcastic)/you
to come with a specific purpose in mind
brother (polite appellation for a friend one's age)
truth to tell/to be quite honest...
